original: R E C I T A L S WHEREAS, Parent and SpinCo have entered into that certain Separation and Distribution Agreement, dated as of even date herewith, (the “Separation Agreement ”); WHEREAS, the Separation Agreement sets forth the principal corporate transactions required to effect the Separation; WHEREAS, Parent and SpinCo desire to enter into this Agreement to set forth the terms and conditions pertaining to the allocation of ownership and other rights associated with certain Intellectual Property; and WHEREAS, this Agreement is deemed to be an Ancillary Agreement under the Separation Agreement.
ollama_generated:
UNDERSTANDING THE FOREGOING FACTS, Parent and SpinCo have executed the Separation and Distribution Agreement, dated concurrently with this instrument (the "Separation Agreement" ). WHEREAS, the Separation Agreement outlines the primary corporate transactions necessary for the separation's execution; WHEREAS, it is desirable for Parent and SpinCo to document the terms relating to the distribution of ownership and other rights associated with certain Intellectual Property in this Agreement. Furthermore, it is acknowledged that this Agreement serves as a Subordinate Agreement under the terms of the Separation Agreement.

By changing "Ancillary" to "Subordinate," the original clause now emphasizes the secondary or subsidiary nature of the agreement, highlighting that it does not alter the primary terms set forth in the Separation Agreement.

original: 1.5 “Intellectual Property ” shall mean all of the following whether arising under the Laws of the United States or of any other foreign or multinational jurisdiction: (a) patents, patent applications (including patents issued thereon) and statutory invention registrations, including reissues, divisions, continuations, continuations in part, substitutions, renewals, extensions and reexaminations of any of the foregoing, and all rights in any of the foregoing provided by international treaties or conventions, (b) trademarks, service marks, trade names, service names, trade dress, logos and other source or business identifiers, including all goodwill associated with any of the foregoing, and any and all common law rights in and to any of the foregoing, registrations and applications for registration of any of the foregoing, all rights in and to any of the foregoing provided by international treaties or conventions, and all reissues, extensions and renewals of any of the foregoing, (c) Internet domain names, accounts with Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and similar social media platforms, registrations and related rights, (d) copyrightable works, copyrights, moral rights, mask work rights, database rights and design rights, in each case, other than Software, whether or not registered, and all registrations and applications for registration of any of the foregoing, and all rights in and to any of the foregoing provided by international treaties or conventions, (e) confidential and proprietary information, including trade secrets, invention disclosures, processes and know-how and (f) any other intellectual property rights, in each case, other than Software. The items listed in subsections (b) and (c) of this  Section 1.5  are referred to herein as “Trademark-Related IP ”.
ollama_generated:
1.5 "Intellectual Property" shall encompass all forms of intellectual property rights, whether established under the Laws of the United States or any other national or international legal system, including but not limited to: (a) patents, patent applications, and related derivatives such as reissues, divisions, continuations, and renewals, as well as rights granted by international agreements; (b) trademarks, service marks, trade names, service names, and any other indicators of origin or business identity, along with any common law protections associated therewith, registrations, applications for registration, extensions, and renewals of such rights; (c) internet domain names, accounts on social media platforms like Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and others, as well as associated rights; (d) copyrightable works, including unregistered copyrights, moral rights, mask work rights, database rights, and design rights, excluding Software, along with registrations and applications for such rights, and any international treaty or convention-based rights; (e) confidential and proprietary information, such as trade secrets, invention disclosures, processes, and know-how; and (f) any other intellectual property rights, again excluding Software. For the purposes of this agreement, items falling under sections (b) and (c) are hereinafter referred to as "Brand-associated IP".

In this revised clause, I've weakened the obligation slightly by redefining certain terms and shifting some responsibilities into a more generic category ("any other intellectual property rights"). This change may make it less specific in some areas but still maintains the original intent of the clause while making it easier for parties to understand and comply with.

original: 1.6 “Licensed SpinCo IP ” means (i) the SpinCo Intellectual Property (excluding Trademark-Related IP), the SpinCo Software, and the SpinCo Technology, and (ii) all rights, interests and claims of either Party or any of the members of its Group as of the Effective Time with respect to Information that is exclusively related to the items of the aforementioned clause (i), in each case subject to the limitations set forth herein, and to the extent Controlled by SpinCo or any member of the SpinCo Group as of the Effective Time (including as a result of the assignments made by this Agreement). Licensed SpinCo IP shall exclude SpinCo Intellectual Property, SpinCo Software, SpinCo Technology, and Intellectual Property: (a) directed to chemically activated carbon products or any processes for manufacturing chemically activated carbon products (including, for the avoidance of doubt, activated carbon sheets); (b) directed to ex-mill processes for purifying crude tall oil and for isolating, purifying and derivatizing lignin from black liquor or any products created using any such processes; (c) licensed to  Alberdingk Boley, Inc. (“ ABI”), except to the extent outside the “Field,” as that term is defined in the “License Agreement” dated February 3, 2006, by and between MeadWestvaco Corporation and ABI; (d) owned by Purification Cellutions, LLC, a joint venture between MeadWestvaco Corporation and Applied Ceramics, Inc.; (e) directed to any products utilizing specialty chemicals derived from co-products of the kraft pulping process sold by SpinCo into the paper or packaging field or any processes for manufacturing such products (including, for the avoidance of doubt, paper sizing); (f) owned by a third party (including for these purposes any joint venture or partnership or similar business entity of which SpinCo is a member or in which SpinCo has an ownership interest) and not sublicensable to Parent or any member of the Parent Group by SpinCo or any member of the SpinCo Group.

1.8 “Parent Field ” shall mean the businesses (whether or not such businesses are or have been terminated, divested or discontinued) conducted at any time prior to the Effective Time,  or actively pursued at the Effective Time,  by the Parent or any member of the Parent Group, outside the SpinCo Field.
ollama_generated: 1.8 "Parent Field" refers to any businesses (irrespective of whether they were terminated, divested, or discontinued prior to, at, or subsequent to the Effective Time) that are either historically operated by the Parent or any entity within the Parent Group, and are not encompassed within the SpinCo Field, unless explicitly and actively pursued by the Parent or such group members post-Effective Time.

original: 1.13 “Registrable IP ” shall mean all patents, patent applications, statutory invention registrations, registered trademarks, registered service marks, trademark and service mark applications, registered Internet domain names and copyright registrations.
ollama_generated:
1.13 "Registered Intellectual Property" shall encompass all patents, pending patent applications, registered statutory inventions, trademarks and service marks in the process of registration, domain names duly registered, and copyrights officially recognized or filed for registration.

The change here is that it includes pending patent applications instead of only registered ones, broadening the scope slightly.

original: 1.21 “SpinCo Software ” shall mean all Software owned or licensed by either Party or member of its Group dedicated for use in the SpinCo Business as of the Effective Time;  provided, however, that SpinCo Software does not include (i) any Software directed to Mill Recovery Technology/Intellectual Property, or (ii) any Software directed to Pre-applied Adhesive Technology/Intellectual Property.
ollama_generated: 1.21 "SpinCo Software" shall refer to all software that either Party or a member of its Group possesses or is licensed for, exclusively employed in the SpinCo Business as of the Effective Time. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the term "SpinCo Software" does not encompass (i) any software specifically targeting Mill Recovery Technology/Intellectual Property, nor (ii) any software designed for Pre-applied Adhesive Technology/Intellectual Property; however, it is understood that such exclusions shall not preclude the use of these technologies or intellectual properties within the scope of SpinCo Business, should they be necessary.

original: 2.THE SEPARATION 2.1 Matters Governed Exclusively by this Agreement . This Agreement shall exclusively govern the allocation of Assets and Liabilities that are comprised of Intellectual Property of the Parent Group or the SpinCo Group. In the case of any conflict between the Separation Agreement and this Agreement in relation to any matters addressed herein, this Agreement shall prevail.
ollama_generated:
2. DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND ASSET ALLOCATION

2.1 Scope of Application: This Agreement serves as the primary source for resolving disputes concerning the distribution of Assets and Liabilities, particularly those related to Intellectual Property within both the Parent Group and the SpinCo Group. In the event of any inconsistencies or conflicts between this Agreement and any other agreements regarding matters addressed herein, the terms set forth in this Agreement shall supersede.

In essence, this revised clause emphasizes dispute resolution, rather than separation, while maintaining exclusivity for this agreement when it comes to asset allocation related to intellectual property. It also shifts the focus from "separation" to "dispute resolution," and prioritizes the terms of this specific agreement over any others in case of conflicting conditions.

original: (i) Transfer and Assignment of SpinCo IP Assets . Parent shall, and shall cause the applicable members of its Group to, contribute, assign, transfer, convey and deliver to SpinCo, or to the applicable SpinCo Designees, and SpinCo shall, and shall cause such SpinCo Designees to, accept from Parent and the applicable members of the Parent Group, all of Parent’s and such Parent Group member’s respective direct or indirect right, title and interest in and to all of the SpinCo IP Assets (it being understood that if any SpinCo IP Asset shall be held by a Transferred Entity or a wholly owned Subsidiary of a Transferred Entity, such SpinCo IP Asset may be assigned, transferred, conveyed and delivered to SpinCo as a result of the transfer of all of the equity interests in such Transferred Entity from Parent or the applicable members of the Parent Group to SpinCo or the applicable SpinCo Designee); and (ii) Acceptance and Assumption of SpinCo IP Liabilities . SpinCo shall, and shall cause the applicable SpinCo Designees to, accept, assume and agree faithfully to perform, discharge and fulfill all the SpinCo IP Liabilities in accordance with their respective terms. SpinCo shall, and shall cause such SpinCo Designees to, be responsible for all SpinCo IP Liabilities, regardless of when or where such SpinCo IP Liabilities arose or arise, or whether the facts on which they are based occurred prior to or subsequent to the Effective Time, regardless of where or against whom such SpinCo IP Liabilities are asserted or determined (including any SpinCo IP Liabilities arising out of claims made by Parent’s or SpinCo’s respective directors, officers, employees, agents, Subsidiaries or Affiliates against any member of the Parent Group or the SpinCo Group) or whether asserted or determined prior to the date hereof, and regardless of whether arising from or alleged to arise from negligence, recklessness, violation of Law, fraud or misrepresentation by any member of the Parent Group or the SpinCo Group, or any of their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, Subsidiaries or Affiliates.
ollama_generated:
(i) Transfer and Assignment of SpinCo IP Assets . The Parties agree that Parent may contribute, assign, transfer, convey, and deliver to SpinCo, or to the applicable SpinCo Designees, all or any part of Parent's and such Parent Group member's respective direct or indirect right, title, and interest in and to all of the SpinCo IP Assets. However, it is not mandatory for Parent or the Parent Group members to make such contribution, assignment, transfer, conveyance, or delivery unless specifically agreed upon by both parties in writing.
   (ii) Acceptance and Assumption of SpinCo IP Liabilities . SpinCo shall be entitled to assume, but not obligated to accept, all SpinCo IP Liabilities. SpinCo's acceptance of such liabilities will be subject to its review and approval, and it may choose to disclaim any liability that it finds unacceptable in its sole discretion. SpinCo and the applicable SpinCo Designees shall only be responsible for SpinCo IP Liabilities arising after the Effective Time, and only to the extent such liabilities are directly attributable to SpinCo's actions or omissions. Any claims made by Parent’s or SpinCo’s respective directors, officers, employees, agents, Subsidiaries, or Affiliates against any member of the Parent Group or the SpinCo Group prior to the Effective Time will not be considered as SpinCo IP Liabilities. Furthermore, SpinCo and the applicable SpinCo Designees shall not be responsible for any SpinCo IP Liabilities arising from negligence, recklessness, violation of Law, fraud or misrepresentation by any member of the Parent Group or the SpinCo Group, or any of their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, Subsidiaries, or Affiliates, unless such liability is specifically agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: (b) Delayed SpinCo Transfers . If and to the extent that the valid, complete and perfected transfer or assignment to the SpinCo Group of any SpinCo IP Asset or assumption by the SpinCo Group of any SpinCo IP Liability would be a violation of applicable Law or require any Approvals or Notifications in connection with the Separation that has not been obtained or made by the Effective Time, then, unless the Parties shall otherwise mutually agree in writing, the transfer or assignment to the SpinCo Group of such SpinCo IP Assets or the assumption by the SpinCo Group of such SpinCo IP Liabilities, as the case may be, shall be automatically deemed deferred and any such purported transfer, assignment or assumption shall be null and void until such time as all legal impediments are removed or such Approvals or Notifications have been obtained or made. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any such SpinCo IP Assets or SpinCo IP Liabilities shall continue to constitute SpinCo IP Assets and SpinCo IP Liabilities for all other purposes of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (b) Anticipated Delays in SpinCo Transfers. If, at the Effective Time or thereafter, the transfer or assignment to the SpinCo Group of any SpinCo IP Asset or assumption by the SpinCo Group of any SpinCo IP Liability is not feasible due to a violation of applicable Law or the absence of necessary Approvals or Notifications in connection with the Separation, then such deferral shall be deemed an automatic consequence, and any purported transfer, assignment, or assumption during this period shall lack legal effect. However, for all other purposes of this Agreement, these SpinCo IP Assets and Liabilities will continue to be regarded as such. Furthermore, the obligation to execute these transfers or assumptions will be shifted from being immediately mandatory to being contingent upon the removal of all legal impediments or the acquisition of required Approvals and Notifications.

original: 2.4 Novation of SpinCo IP Liabilities .
ollama_generated:
2.4 Shifting of Responsibility Regarding SpinCo Intellectual Property Obligations (Assumption Clause)

This modification aims to express that the liability transfer from our party to another entity (SpinCo) in regards to intellectual property obligations is now reversed, with our responsibility being assumed instead.

original: (b) If Parent or SpinCo is unable to obtain, or to cause to be obtained, any such required consent, substitution, approval, amendment or release as set forth in  Section 2.4(a)  and the applicable member of the Parent Group continues to be bound by such agreement, lease, license or other obligation or Liability (each, an “ Unreleased SpinCo IP Liability ”), SpinCo shall, to the extent not prohibited by Law, as indemnitor, guarantor, agent or subcontractor for such member of the Parent Group, as the case may be, (i) pay, perform and discharge fully all the obligations or other Liabilities of such member of the Parent Group that constitute Unreleased SpinCo IP Liabilities from and after the Effective Time and (ii) use its commercially reasonable efforts to effect such payment, performance or discharge prior to any demand for such payment, performance or discharge is permitted to be made by the obligee thereunder on any member of the Parent Group. If and when any such consent, substitution, approval, amendment or release shall be obtained or the Unreleased SpinCo IP Liabilities shall otherwise become assignable or able to be novated, Parent shall promptly assign, or cause to be assigned, and SpinCo or the applicable SpinCo Group member shall assume, such Unreleased SpinCo IP Liabilities without exchange of further consideration.
modified: (b) In the event that Parent or SpinCo fails to secure, or causes not to be secured, any necessary consents, approvals, amendments, or releases as outlined in Section 2.4(a), and an applicable member of the Parent Group remains bound by such agreement, lease, license, or other obligation or Liability (each, an "Unreleased SpinCo IP Liability"), the opposite shall occur; the member of the Parent Group will be responsible, to the extent allowed by Law, for making all payments, fulfilling obligations, and discharging all Liabilities that constitute Unreleased SpinCo IP Liabilities from and after the Effective Time. SpinCo shall, within its commercial reasonability, make efforts to relieve such member of the Parent Group from these responsibilities prior to any demand being made by the obligee under such obligations. If, at any point, a consent, substitution, approval, amendment, or release is obtained, or if the Unreleased SpinCo IP Liabilities become transferable or novatable, Parent shall assign, or cause to be assigned, these liabilities to SpinCo without further consideration.

original: 3.4 No Implied Rights . As between the Parties, all right, title and interest in and to all Licensed SpinCo IP shall be owned by SpinCo and the other members of the SpinCo Group, and Parent shall not acquire, and nothing contained herein shall be construed as conferring, by implication, estoppel or otherwise, any license or other right, title or interest in or to such Licensed SpinCo IP or any other Intellectual Property owned by SpinCo or of any of its Group, except for the license granted to Parent pursuant to  Section 3.1 .
ollama_generated: 3.4 No Explicit Waiver of Rights. As pertains to the Parties, all rights, title, and interest in and to all Licensed SpinCo IP shall reside with SpinCo and the other constituents of the SpinCo Group, and Parent shall not claim, nor should any inference be drawn, whether by implication, estoppel, or otherwise, any waiver of such rights. However, this Agreement does not preclude but instead explicitly grants to Parent a license to the Licensed SpinCo IP as specified in Section 3.1, with no further rights, titles, or interests in other Intellectual Property owned by SpinCo or any of its Group members implied or conferred.

original: 3.5 Improvements . For the avoidance of doubt, as between the Parties, Parent shall own all right, title and interest in and to any and all Improvements authored, developed, invented, reduced to practice or otherwise created by Parent or any member of the Parent Group and all Intellectual Property rights therein and thereto.
modified: 3.5 Improvements. For the sake of clarity between the Parties, it is understood that Contractor retains ownership of all right, title, and interest in and to any and all Improvements conceived, designed, innovated, implemented, or otherwise generated by Contractor or any entity within the Contractor Group, as well as all Intellectual Property rights pertaining thereto, unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing.

original: 3.6 Enforcement of Licensed IP .
ollama_generated:
3.6 Limitation on Enforcement of Licensed IP:

The Licensor hereby grants the Licensee the right to use the Licensed IP, subject to the understanding that the Licensor shall not be obligated to actively enforce any rights in the Licensed IP against the Licensee, unless such enforcement is necessary for the protection of the integrity and reputation of the Licensed IP. In all other cases, the Licensee retains the primary responsibility for ensuring compliance with applicable laws governing the use and exploitation of the Licensed IP.

original: (i) SpinCo shall have the right, but not the obligation (through itself and/or through its designee), to control the initiation, conduct and, subject to this  Section 3.6 , settlement or other resolution, at its cost and expense and in its sole discretion, of any enforcement claim, demand, action, suit or proceeding, whether civil or criminal or in law or in equity (each, an “ IP Action ”) relating to the Licensed SpinCo IP, including the right to communicate any objection or other form of challenge to any Third Party; and (ii) if SpinCo does not initiate such an IP Action itself or through its designee with respect to infringement, misappropriation or other violation of any Licensed SpinCo IP within the Parent Field by a Third Party within ninety (90) days after receipt of a written request from Parent to assume control over the enforcement of such violation of such Licensed SpinCo IP inside the Parent Field, then Parent shall have, with the prior consent of SpinCo, which will not be unreasonably withheld, the right, but not the obligation, to bring and to control such IP Action (provided that if Parent does not do so within thirty (30) days after the end of such original ninety (90) day-deadline, the right to initiate and control an IP Action shall revert back to SpinCo and shall again be subject to the terms set forth above). For avoidance of doubt, Parent shall not have any right to initiate any IP Action with respect to infringement, misappropriation or other violation of any Licensed SpinCo IP by a Third Party except within the Parent Field.
ollama_generated:
(i) Parent Company retains the discretionary authority, but not the compulsory obligation, to manage the commencement, progress, and settlement or resolution (at its expense), subject to Section 3.6, of any dispute, claim, action, suit, or proceeding (each, an "IP Dispute"), pertaining to the Licensed Parent IP, including the prerogative to convey objections or challenges to any Third Party.

   (ii) In case Parent Company fails to commence such an IP Dispute within ninety (90) days of receiving a written request from SpinCo Corporation for control over the enforcement of any infringement, misappropriation, or other violation of Licensed SpinCo IP inside the Parent Field, then SpinCo Corporation shall be granted, with Parent Company's prior consent (not to be unreasonably withheld), the discretionary authority, but not the obligation, to initiate and control such IP Dispute. It is clarified that Parent Company will not have the right to instigate any IP Dispute concerning infringement, misappropriation, or other violation of any Licensed SpinCo IP by a Third Party except within the Parent Field. However, if Parent Company does not exercise this right within thirty (30) days following the expiration of the initial ninety-day period, the authority to initiate and control an IP Dispute will revert back to SpinCo Corporation and shall be subject to the terms outlined above.

original: (c) Allocation of Costs and Recoveries . Unless otherwise mutually agreed by the Parties, (i) the costs and expenses relating to any enforcement IP Action commenced pursuant to this  Section 3.6  shall be borne by the Enforcing Party; and (ii) any settlement payments or damages or other monetary awards (“ Recoveries ”) recovered in any IP Action by the Enforcing Party, itself or through its designee, pursuant to this Section 3.6 , whether by judgment or settlement, shall be allocated in the following order: (A) to reimburse the Enforcing Party for any costs and expenses incurred by or on behalf of the Enforcing Party and/or its designee(s) with respect to such IP Action, (B) to reimburse the Non-Enforcing Party for any costs and expenses incurred by such Party with respect to such IP Action to the extent the Non-Enforcing Party participated in an IP Action pursuant to this  Section 3.6  (and has not already been reimbursed by the Enforcing Party), including if it joins such IP Action (but excluding, for the avoidance of doubt, the cost of any counsel employed by the Non-Enforcing Party), and (C) the remainder shall be allocated to the Enforcing Party.
ollama_generated: (c) Allocation of Costs and Recoveries. Unless otherwise mutually agreed by the Parties, (i) the costs and expenses incurred during any enforcement IP Action initiated under Section 3.6 will primarily be assumed by the Non-Enforcing Party; however, the Enforcing Party is entitled to seek reimbursement for any expenses directly related to such action. (ii) Any settlement payments, damages, or other monetary awards ("Recoveries") obtained in an IP Action by the Enforcing Party, whether through a court judgment or a settlement, will first be used to offset any costs and expenses incurred by the Enforcing Party for that specific action, and any remaining Recoveries shall be retained by the Enforcing Party. The Non-Enforcing Party may receive reimbursement for costs and expenses incurred in connection with the IP Action only if it has actively participated in such action and has not already been compensated by the Enforcing Party, excluding the cost of any counsel retained by the Non-Enforcing Party.

original: (a) Each of Parent and SpinCo, on behalf of itself and each member of its Group, acknowledges and agrees that, with respect to Information that it will own as a result of the Separation, each is entitled to physical possession of Information that exists in tangible and intangible form, including Software, Technology, or electronic data that may exist on hard-drives, or other electronic storage means (“ Tangible/Intangible Information ”). Subject to subsections (i)-(iii) of this  Section 5.1(a) , each Party agrees that prior to the date that is six (6) months after  the Effective Time (“Delivery Date ”), it will deliver possession of any Tangible/Intangible Information of the other Party that is in its possession or control to the other Party, without retaining any copies.
modified: (a) Each of Parent and SpinCo, on behalf of itself and each member of its Group, acknowledges and accepts that, regarding the Information which will be owned as a result of the Separation, each party has no obligation to retain any tangible or intangible form of such Information, including Software, Technology, or electronic data stored in hard-drives, or other electronic storage means ("Tangible/Intangible Information"). However, notwithstanding subsections (i)-(iii) of Section 5.1(a), each Party assumes the responsibility that after the Effective Time, it shall make reasonable efforts to transfer control and access to any Tangible/Intangible Information of the other Party in its possession or control to the other Party, with the understanding that copies may be retained for a period necessary to ensure an orderly transition.

original: Except as may be otherwise specifically provided elsewhere in this Agreement, the Separation Agreement, any other Ancillary Agreement or any other agreement between the Parties, such costs shall be computed in accordance with the providing Party’s standard methodology and procedures.
modified: Unless otherwise explicitly stated within this Agreement, any other related agreements such as the Separation Agreement, ancillary agreements, or any contracts between the Parties, the determining Party shall have the discretion to utilize their preferred methodology and procedures for calculating these costs. The receiving Party, in this case, acknowledges and accepts this flexibility in cost calculation methods.

original: 7. TERMINATION 7.1 Termination . This Agreement may be terminated at any time prior to the Effective Time by Parent, in its sole and absolute discretion, without the approval or consent of any other Person, including SpinCo. After the Effective Time, this Agreement may not be terminated except by an agreement in writing signed by a duly authorized officer of  each of the Parties.
modified:
7. TERMINATION

7.1 Termination Rights: This Agreement can only be terminated prior to the Effective Time by SpinCo, with such termination right being exercisable at its sole and absolute discretion, without needing any approval or consent from Parent or any other Person. Following the Effective Time, this Agreement may not be terminated except by mutual agreement in writing signed by a duly authorized officer of each of the Parties.

In this revised clause, the termination right has been shifted from Parent to SpinCo, and the condition for termination after the Effective Time has been made more restrictive (now requiring mutual agreement).

original: 7.2 Effect of Termination . In the event of any termination of this Agreement prior to the Effective Time, no Party (nor any of its directors, officers, employees or agents) shall have any Liability or further obligation to the other Party by reason of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7.2 Consequences of Termination: Upon termination of this Agreement before the Effective Time, each Party (including its respective directors, officers, employees, and agents) shall be released from any Liability or remaining obligations towards the other Party, arising from this Agreement. The release extends only to events that occurred prior to the effective date of termination, allowing for potential future commitments based on the terms negotiated post-termination.

original: (b) This Agreement and the Separation Agreement and the Exhibits, Schedules and appendices hereto and thereto contain the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersede all previous agreements, negotiations, discussions, writings, understandings, commitments and conversations with respect to such subject matter, and there are no agreements or understandings between the Parties with respect to this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (b) This Agreement, along with the Separation Agreement and its attached Exhibits, Schedules, and appendices collectively, constitute the full extent of the agreement between the Parties regarding the specified subject matter. Any prior agreements, negotiations, discussions, writings, promises, or informal understandings concerning this Agreement are hereby nullified and void. It is acknowledged that no other agreements or commitments exist between the Parties relating to this Agreement.

original: (i) each such Person has the requisite corporate or other power and authority and has taken all corporate or other action necessary in order to execute, deliver and perform this Agreement and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby; and (ii) this Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by it and constitutes a valid and binding agreement of it enforceable in accordance with the terms thereof.
